page.title: 07DAIRY FARM __ continued.
page.content: of Agriculture to be certain it reaches satisfactory standards.During power cuts a generator is used to maintain milking.After calving a cow will suckle her calf for ten days and then return to the milking herd. A bull calf will be sold at Shrewsbury market.A heifer is kept and in time will join the milking herd.About 60 heifer calves are reared in one year.A barren cow will be sold at market.The cows are served by a Friesian bull, Colleycroft Architect.Ear tags on the beast detail the siring (parentage). A brand mark number is put on the rump when it joins the milking herd.There is a Charolais bull called Snowpuddle with seven cows but the milk yield per cow is much lower.Veterinary services are kept to a minimum for reasons of cost.Treatment for a cow about to calve consisted of 500 cc injection of
